title: Easy process
text: All process from start to end was very smooth without any issue.I'll use again!!!

title: PayPal instructions were off-putting
text: I can’t review the product because I haven’t received it yet. It looks great, or I wouldn’t have purchased it.My only complaint is that I pay with PayPal and your directions for doing so were very confusing.  I almost cancelled my order because I couldn’t pay for it.

title: Easy site experience, but "Help" not helpful
text: The website is fairly intuitive to use. I found it easy to filter the specific categories I was interested in, making my time quick on the site. The one thing I found problematic was, I have no way of knowing if my Credit Card information is visible to the Seller, or if my Credit Card data is being store on either the Seller's site or the Ruby Lane site. I tried to find out on the Ruby Lane site, but got nowhere. Very frustrating!

title: A great site with one exception
text: my only complaint about ruby lane is how time consuming it is to check out.  each item has to go through PayPal or my credit card separately, instead of just paying for it all at once. I understand there are different vendors and so on, but couldn't ruby lane figure out a way to distribute the money to each vendor, to speed up the process.  when I buy 3 or 4 pieces, it's a long story to check out.  otherwise, a great site, fast posting, and pieces are always as described.

title: Vendor cancelled order
text: Initial vender experience was great.  Found something I wanted and PayPal worked smoothly.  Then, vendor may not be as good as I first thought. Vendor cancelled order claiming damage but original picture showed no damage.  Would like to see photo of damaged item to preclude feeling seller changed mind on price. Would like to complete original purchase and write a much better review. The following observation was directed to the Ruby Lane site software:The cookie preferences experience was a disaster, at least on my i-phone screen. This needs to be simplified and functional. Thanks for any updates and corrections. Bob

title: Generally a good site
text: Generally a good site. I was excited when they finally separated the antiques from collectibles. Then the "Antique" button disappeared AGAIN. So I am back to sifting through. A real pet peeve.Also, the Wish List should be alphabetized by shop to make items easier to find.

title: I love Ruby Lane
text: I love Ruby Lane. I’ve made over 100 purchases. Only a couple of glitches  Shop owners have been very responsive to any questions or concerns I have had.  Why only 4 stars?  Because. I am up at 5am pacific time and look at my daily wish list at about 5:15. Often, things I would have purchased, are already sold. I suspect that the East coast receives notifications earlier, due to the time zones. Only complaint

title: Handling experiences
text: Very good and frequent informations concerning new finds.Timely reference to "Red Tag" is very good."Red Tag": Start time and time end also in CET is perfect.The page with the individual offer contains nearly all the necessary information for the purchase. Sadly missing: The information about the country of the seller.After having closed a site the order of the offered items has changed when reopening the same site. Finding a certain item again is difficult.

title: A little confusing that invoices say…
text: A little confusing that invoices say “don’t forget to make your payment” (?) I thought I did. So then I had to check PayPal to make sure I did. It would be better to keep viewing items without having to tap the next page, page after page and then it’s a real drag if you tap wrong spot. Makes shopping inconvenient and not efficient.

title: Was able to get all the items from my…
text: Was able to get all the items from my wish list easily via paypal. Used 4 different vendors. What is needed is a way to get back to my cart from Ruby Lane site after I'd paid one vendor and gotten the transaction notice, without having to pull up their site again.

title: I got return emails quickly on my question.
text: I got return emails quickly on my question about paying without a PayPal account (I had given mine up) and fortunately the item purchased was still in my "basket." Sometimes it would be nice to have a search window for something seen in the past that one wants to recall. This is my third or fourth purchase from Ruby Lane. Ruby Lane has a nice variety of interesting objects.

title: Great antique and vintage dealers!
text: Great antique and vintage dealers from across the globe and at all price points. I enjoy the format for searching for items Ruby Lane offers. The sales you hold periodically are a big incentive to search, shop and buy. I wish your search engine would recognize misspelled words like other on line platforms. Checkout is a bit confusing sometimes, when you think you’ve  paid, but have not, but is easily corrected.  I wish you would feature some educational posts or short videos featuring knowledgeable Ruby Lane dealers/sellers, regarding Chinese export china, vernacular photography, coin silver or costume jewelry, etc.  Informed buyers are confident buyers and build collections as their knowledge in a collecting field grows.

title: What can be a time waster.
text: Mostly my experiences are good but I do find it annoying when I go to purchase something that has been recommended to me only to find they won"t ship to Australia. I would prefer not to have wasted my time.

title: Seller and site were great; payment procedure a little confusing
text: I quickly found what I was looking for and have already received a message from the seller that it will be shipped tomorrow.  The only slight downside was that when I went to pay, I chose the PayPal option, but then it also asked me for my credit card info (which is saved on PayPal), and I was concerned that the payment had been made twice.  It was a little bit confusing.

title: Payment issue
text: When I was trying to pay it had a selection for PayPal,debit card, etc which I clicked on.I went to another screen and put in my Discover card info and THEN received an email from PayPal that theyhad paid it.  I really did NOT want to pay with PayPal but it's hard to get to credit card info Now I'm worried about being charged twice.Otherwise, ok experience.

title: Venmo payment option wasn't offered until after checkout
text: Was my first purchase from Ruby Lane and it was overall good. One thing I was disappointed with was after going through the checkout and payment process, the order confirmation page mentioned Venmo as one of the payment options. I didn't see the Venmo payment option prior to checkout, in fact, PayPal (and/or credit card via PayPal) was the only option offered to me. I would have preferred using Venmo for my purchase! :(

title: Was unable to communicate with buyer…
text: Was unable to communicate with buyer prior to my purchase. I wanted to discuss the cost of shipping. I was held hostage, as in pay what I want or cancel the transaction. Very unhappy!

title: App wants to keep you in the same shop
text: If you look at an item in a shop, the algorithm wants to keep you in the same shop even if the next item is in a different category.  It’s difficult to get back to browsing all vendors as the app wants to limit your searches to the last shop you were in.

title: Overall very good experience
text: The interface with PayPal, at least in Chrome, was awkward and confusing. Everything else was great and my interaction with the seller was exemplary.  I am very happy with my purchase and am eager to receive the package.

title: Ruby Lane has great and hard to find items
text: Ruby Lane has great and hard to usually find products, which makes shooping there a delight.Sometimes though navigating the process of arranging tghe shipping with the seller is cumbersome.

title: Vintage
text: Great seller to work with

title: Red Tag Sale
text: Red Tag Sale  - when you advertise it as a 50% off sale everything should really be 50% off. I saw many items that weren't 50% off and if thats how you advertise the sale dealers should not be listing an item that isn't truly 50% off. It's a waste of my time to scroll through pages and pages of items Im interested in to find something I want thats less than the advertised 50% off Tag Line that heads up your page. If you are advertising it as a 50% off sale everything listed should adhere to that rule.

title: I purchased earrings from A Vintage…
text: I purchased earrings from A Vintage Love Affair through Ruby Lane. My earrings arrived much earlier than the anticipated date. I am very happy woyhmy purchase and will shops onRuby Lane again.

title: They responded to my question quickly
text: They responded to my question quickly. Loved the unique items on their site. Not too keen on the need for authorization links to be sent for completing purchase as the links were only good for a few minutes and I kept missing the emails and had to try again and again. A bit frustrating.

title: Great range of products
text: Great range of products. Great site.  Just tough to find out the real cost when you are buying from outside of the US.  A currency converter would be nice as would being able to tell what the brokerage fees and import duties will be.  It ends up being quite expensive and a surprise.

title: Love Ruby Lane
text: I love so much about Ruby Lane, Particularly the very unique items offered. Pricing is great in many items and I love being able to make a favorites list of items that I can go to when I wish to treat myself. The one thing I would love for this company to do is allow sellers to put one item up for sale and simply take a percentage of the sale o f the item. The current standard is not feasible for just one item. Thank you.

title: Shipping has caused me to cut down on…
text: Shipping has caused me to cut down on my purchases.I still would prefer my wish list be alphabetized by seller. It is cumbersome. I have asked that you consider this a few times.Also, finding past purchases is far harder since the "completed" tab often does not appear.Thank you

title: Room for improvement RUBY !
text: Ruby lane is a good platform,many of the sellers are obliging , but if wishing to send a purchased item to another address in another country as a gift is currently rather  cumbersome & could be greatly improved ! Although achievable, if you are persistent, the instructions on how to do this are still  currently very vague !

title: Nicely curated selection
text: I was looking for something specific and found the nicest examples on Ruby Lane. I did place an order, but almost a week later I see no means of tracking its delivery.

title: Order went through smoothly but...
text: Order went through smoothly, but then I had to reverify my email address in order to complete the order. The first time, the reverification email didn't show up.

title: "group" dynamic
text: This is an on-line "group". I understand. Checking out is quite complex for me, a first-timer. I had to keep circling  back to make multiple purchases.Now awaiting the "treasure"Carl

title: I wrote my earlier review stating I was…
text: I wrote my earlier review stating I was unable to communicate with the seller. Rubylane then pointed you that I missed a circle that said contact seller. I was new to RubyLane and must have missed seeing the circle for contacting the seller. MY FAULT! So sorry!

title: A trusted source!
text: I used to sell at Ruby Lane, and I still converse with the customers I had. Some became good friends. I just could no longer afford the rent, during slow months. There are so many people that don't even know Ruby Lane exists, however, I still shop there often! I am never disappointed in the deals I can find there!Thanks,Teresa

title: To much re-entering password if the…
text: To much re-entering password if the buyer has not ordered for a while. I cannot be ordering from Ruby all the time. Why make the buyer go thru so much in useing same password?? Too much of a bother

title: Wonderful products
text: Wonderful products, excellently presented. Ordering a bit clunky though, as payment can't be made until the seller cofirms the postage cost etc.

title: Shipping and insurance option
text: The shipping and insurance options (media vs. ground advantage) made the difference in the sale for me. Saved me about $3. The verification of email address was bothersome.

title: Payment of items is NOT always as EZ as 1-2-3!
text: It was not absolutely trouble free to complete my transaction because I had to keep entering my choice of card to use as payment.  It became very frustrating trying to enter all the necessary information before the two items were paid.

title: Pay with PayPal option did not work
text: Pay with PayPal option did not work, only loaded a blank page;  this meant extra time typing in payment & address, for each separate order.

title: I love it when you can purchase…
text: I love it when you can purchase something and they can send it to Canada. I also like if they can send it in such a way that I don’t have to pay a large amount of Canadian duty.

title: I would have given a 5 star but
text: I would have given a 5 star but, when I saw it was paid by PayPal I was alarmed as i had just entered my credit card info. Please spare me the angst of giving my CC and to see it said paypal!!

title: pay pal?
text: Even though I paid with a credit card it went through pay pal.  I don't believe there was enough information to understand why.

title: I was still in your system after quite a while...
text: The fact that even though it had been some time since I ordered from Ruby Lane, you still had my information and I was able to reset my password. The rest was easy.

title: Some Irksome Things About the Purchase Protocol
text: Actually, I believe your order process should be tweaked.  I put in a bid for a pair of whisky glasses at Douglas Lane Antiques.  I was told it wasn't accepted.  So, I wanted to offer more.  I sent a message to DLA asking if they'd accept my next higher bid.  Regina, at DLA, was very helpful and agreed to the price proposed.  Upon her direction, I went back to your website and attempted to key in the new agreed-upon price and then order the items.  But it wouldn't allow me to enter the agreed-upon price.  I got back with Regina who contacted you all. She was told that the system would not allow me to enter a new bid.  Thus, she was able to discount the item (to the price she and I agreed upon.  I then went back into the site to purchase it.  But I kept being cued to do so by using PayPal, which I didn't want to do.  I continued clicking on "change" (for the method of payment I wished to use).  But that didn't work.  Finally, I found directions that directed me to go ahead and press "PayPal" and then on a subsequent page, click on debit card/credit card.  I did that and it worked.It was kind of frustrating to navigate your purchase process due to the lack of clarity and efficiency in the way you have things set up.  However, again Regina at Douglas Lane Antiques was very helpful and thus, did a great job.  I look forward to receiving the glasses!

title: Old Browser
text: I enjoy receiving the daily email from Ruby Lane. I just wish the browser supported Safari. other than that, everything is okay.

title: I may die of old age before my item finally gets hereQ!
text: I dealt with a jeweler who deals through Ruby Lane.  My payment (by credit card) had to go through PayPal. Thus far it has taken over a month to get a small, not very valuable bracelet to (still) not get here.  As I am in my late 80's, I don't really have much time to waste! *Bet they don't post this one!

title: Staff responds quickly to "Help"…
text: Staff responds quickly to "Help" notice. Tech staff is excellent. Wish our photos would go up more quickly and instantly like ebay.

title: Ruby Lane-One Road I Love To Travel
text: This review does not concern, just Ruby Lane. It flows into other areas as welI. I loved Ruby Lane, since it started, years ago. My main concern has been of course the price of objects; yet shipping has cut many a deal. Thought of how it can be rectified. Know that size of boxes, increase cost and days on the road also. If people could have a choice of shipping days, and prices that may help both buyer's and sellers; sell their product easier.Also when I looked for Ruby Lane Discount Codes. Most were not available. I'm not a person, who understands that part of the business; but feel it's an area that draws, people in. One item I looked at was not cleaned and that put me off. Also, no returns. But sellers have their reasons to choose certain paths. Thanks for this request.

title: While the seller did an excellent job…
text: While the seller did an excellent job of packaging the items I ordered, he did not double-check the USPS print-out label address, which listed a different street to the correct one he had provided on a hand-written Priority Mail label.As a consequence, the package was kept at the local Post Office annex, and by the time I realized the package was five days overdue, the annex was about to return the package to the seller.

title: Buying was excellent, signing on not so much
text: Everything about the buying was good except that in signing up, I had to accept all sorts of policies and conditions that were really meant for sellers and did not like having to go through that part of the process in order to buy.

title: Professional, prompt service
text: The seller (at Grandpa's Shed) quickly answered my Email question.My order arrived promptly and was packaged well.I'm very pleased with my purchase 😄

title: PayPal Charged instead of Credit Card
text: It was good.  For some reason even though I entered my credit card info, the purchase was charged to my PayPal account.  I don't know how this happened - it could have been my error.

title: Still
text: Still, waiting to find out about an order that was not received. Did contact the shop owner. And, contact him Ruby Lane help line. As of now we have not heard anything at all.

title: Nice that items can be saved
text: Nice that items can be saved.  Search for specific items works well.  Would be better to show total cost in item search— include shipping and handling.

title: Smooth landing!!
text: Few times that I found what I was looking for when shopping, especially for vintage items! Great choices. Happy shopper.

title: I live in Canada
text: I live in Canada, and I find that many sellers do not ship to Canada unless I email and ask them to. Many times the doll I'm interested in has sold while I was waiting for a reply. Listen up sellers!!! Canadians collect dolls too. This puirchase went well. I emailed the seller, she got right back to me, and I purchased the doll. Very pleased.

title: The experience was good
text: The experience was good. It was easy to navigate through the system. Pricing was what I expected for the item I was looking for

title: vintage solid gold jewelry and…
text: Love vintage solid gold jewelry and have found many items.  Efficient shipping.

title: Always like the variety on Ruby…
text: Always like the variety on Ruby Lane-however your exchange rate is a bit high 129 GB is $ 163?  I can always find the unique on Ruby Lane.

title: FOR THE MOST PART I CAN SAY THAT MY…
text: FOR THE MOST PART I CAN SAY THAT MY EXPERANCES HAVE BEEN GOOD. I HAVE HAD A TIME OR TWO THAT I HAVE BID WITH NO   RESPONSE THEN LATER HAVE FOUND THAT I MISSED THE RESPONSE AFTER TIME WAS UP. I ALSO HAD TROUBLE PAYING FOR A ITEM A COUPLE OF TIMES. ALL IN ALL I HAVE BEEN HAPPY.

title: Had a lot of trouble getting the site…
text: Had a lot of trouble getting the site to take my password in order for me to send a question to the seller.

title: Payment problem
text: I paid with my credit card but the payment was charged to Paypal which I never use, and don't want to use.

title: shipping an item on the red tag…
text: I just bought an item on the red tag sale at 50% off.  I was surprised when the shipping was $5 more than the item.  It was my choice to go on with the purchase and I did.  I wanted the item.

title: It was ok
text: It was ok, but I wanted to pay by credit card, and ended up pushing the paypal icon, not hard to do.

title: Good experience
text: I had a good expeerience but I find both Ruby Lane and Arnold's web sites hard to navigate. But I will return to shop!

title: Vender
text: Vender. Hate conversion to American dollars and very high postal rates compared to Canadian. My experience is mostly excellent.

title: The purchase was easy
text: The purchase was easy. Haven’t received yet, but may change rating once received.

title: I like the selection of items available…
text: I like the selection of items available on Ruby Lane. It reminds me of walking through a huge antique mall. I found an item, contacted the dealer, and settled on a price in only 1 day. The store is massive and, I am sure, anyone can find exactly what they are looking for.

title: Ring style i liked
text: Ring style i liked, but more expensive than i had anticipated.

title: The dealer refused the sale because…already sold
text: I did not get my item that I had purchase, because they already sold it.

title: My purchase was at a great price
text: My purchase was at a great price.  I just wish more desired dolls were on sale or for sale.  I don’t see many Tonners, BJDs, or more modern dolls.  I don’t collect antique so perhaps this isn’t the place for me??????

title: I love shopping on Ruby Lane for the…
text: I love shopping on Ruby Lane for the great selections

title: Your prices are high compared to other…
text: Your prices are high compared to other websites.

title: Pure Gold
text: I am buying this beautiful piece because it is replacing the one given to me from my husband. It was his mothers. The original piece was stolen from our home. I am happily shocked that my husband found it on your site. We bought it right then. Thank you!

title: The creating account app wasn't exactly…
text: The creating account app wasn't exactly user-friendly.  It took me a few tries to get the address part accepted and be able to complete the order.  Also, what is this Paypal business?--I paid with a debit card which it acknowledged--I don't want anything to do with Paypal. **I NEVER SELECTED PAYPAL AND HAVE SINCE GOTTEN AN EMAIL FROM THEM ABOUT CHANGING MY ORDER TO PAYPAL** (This is what the company I'm retired from called "customer irritants" and tried to eliminate).

title: Changing shipping address is hard
text: Changing shipping address is hard. Needs to be easy. The word change doesn’t work.

title: Enough photos to determine condition of…
text: Enough photos to determine condition of item.  Honesty in description of item.

title: No forced Paypal use please!
text: I have not received the product yet so I can not review it. I do not like the fact that when I paid for the item, with my credit card, it automatically transferred over to PayPal. I would NOT have used Ruby Lane if I knew the payment had to go thru PayPal, which just happens to be a terrible company. They do NOT help the purchaser, they are truly a useless company. I vowed to never, ever use them again and now I was forced to!

title: You have wonderful items to choose from…
text: You have wonderful items to choose from and you guided me through the process.  I have a very hard time with passwords.

title: Good experience over many years
text: Have ordered from various Ruby Lane resellers for many years. Only once did I have a less than great experience. Overall sellers have been honest and forthright and photos are accurate as to condition of items. I've ordered porcelain, glass, and antique jewelry.

title: Worked out fine
text: I found a fob that was close to what I was looking for a pocket watch.

title: Ease of checkout
text: Ease of checkout . Was only about the second time I used it but I liked the store I used and will use the site again.

title: Issue I had was not being able to…
text: Issue I had was not being able to cancel one of the items.  Just was able to do it.

title: Purchase of 1930's toy truck
text: This item looks really interesting, and like an unusual Christmas item for the house. I believe the price was a bit high, but in this case I am willing to pay it.

title: I was able to an hard to find item
text: I was able to an hard to find item. I believed the item didn't exist.

title: Only one complaint
text: Nice sellers.  Lovely items.  Love it when they have a sale!Only complaint is that when you do a search, they add back in things you have already seen. Not sure why that happens but it’s annoying to see the same listing more than once when there are so many things to look at.

title: I use Ruby Lane a great deal and have…
text: I use Ruby Lane a great deal and have enjoyed doing so for several years.  I find some postage costs a little high, particularly for small aper items, i. e. postcards.  I wish you would advise dealers when their prices are ridiculously high and when the items could not possibly be anywhere that in value.  For example, I have seen adds for common used postage stamps whose catalogue value is less than two or even one dollar offered at grossly inflated prices.  In these cases, the charitable view is that the dealer does not know the true value of his items.  the less charitable view is that the dealer hopes to snare a customer who likewise know the value of the item.  I understand the business principle of Caveat Emptor, but it makes Ruby Lane look bad to me and probably others.I hope you will consider this criticism.  Over the years, I have had very little problem with my purchases.These are general remarks about Ruby lane and not a specific experience.

title: Good source for unique vintage
text: Ruby Lane is a great online site for vintage and antique items. The check-out is a bit pokey and needs to be upgraded. Otherwise I enjoy browsing and purchasing from the variety of shop owners.

title: For the most part, I’m satisfied.
text: All in all, I’m satisfied, but for the manner in which the checkout system was attempting to change my primary billing address to my “secondary” shipping address and wouldn’t permit me to distinguish between the two addresses no matter how I edited my account’s address book.

title: Love Ruby Lane, Checkout Process is Confusing
text: I love shopping through Ruby Lane. I get many gifts here because the items are unique and verified. Recently the site has changed to make buying a two step process, at least through Pay Pal. It's hard to tell if a payment was actually made. I'm pretty tech savvy so if I get confused, I'm sure others do too, especially older buyers who are used to a one step purchase process. Other than that, I have only good things to say about RL.

title: Confusing
text: I think it woud be easier for a buyer to enterthere name and address at sign up than havingto add it in the Address Book.  I know it's forthe buyer's privacy, but it's a little confusing.  AlsoI would add some color to the pages on Rubylane.Thank you.

title: Its fine if you pay with paypal
text: Its fine if you pay with paypal. I tried to add a credit card but there is no where I could find to do this.  It seems I have to message it to the seller, which isn't as streamlined as I prefer at these prices.

title: A pleasent experience
text: An easy time buying the piece of pottery.A++++

title: Selection is all cool
text: Selection is all cool. Unique pov. Apple Pay pls.

title: Very nice site with numerous vendors…
text: Very nice site with numerous vendors who carry quality goods. Like anywhere else, some of the shops' pricing runs a little too high for me, but the quality is there. Most of the vendors are very friendly, pleasant to purchase from, and communicate well. Website is sometimes awkward to navigate, and I think your messaging system could use some improvement.

title: Great website
text: Great website, works as it should  so I don't have any complaints. I did not have any issue searching for items and locating any details that I needed. I've recently interacted with a shop owner and all my inquires were resolved to both our satisfactions. If antiques/vintage items are your love, give this site a try. Ruby Lane has some one of a kind items!

title: Unique one-of-a-kind items
text: You can find just about anything on this website, especially unique things, and the best part is you can barter on the price, you can ask vender any questions about the product, Vendor even points out the flaws so you are not surprised when you get your purchase. I ordered two cloth military patches, somehow the shipping cost for these two lightweight items is as much as the total costs of merchandise,$19.00 shipping fee? Kinda high!

title: great deals on vintage jewelry
text: great deals on vintage jewelry, which I love.  I would like it better if sellers wererequired to list the dimensions of items, as some have come much smaller than  I would like.  But on the whole this is a great source for everyday jewelry and is the only place I buy my jewelry.

title: Good quality merchandise and service. Checkout needs streamlining.
text: The quality of the merchandise is generally pretty good and I feel comfortable buying off it since I know I can return it within a limited time if I get it and don't like it. The checkout process is pretty convoluted though. I wanted to pay through PayPal using a credit card and got a little lost. That's especially worrying because I've been using PayPal for years. Newer users would be pretty lost!

title: First Time, Definitely Not Last
text: Being a first-time buyer was a somewhat confusing experience - thus the 4 Stars. After placing an initial offer, it wasn’t as clear as other sites if the offer had been accepted. Just an acknowledgment box over the screen would clarify the situation. Other than that, the site is great! The seller with whom I worked was a friendly professional, who was easy to contact.

title: I love Ruby Lane
text: I love Ruby Lane! The only things I find really annoying is that you cannot just pick out what you wish to purchase from your cart. You must either purchase everything in your cart, or send the other items to a love list which cannot be managed well due to the slowness of the site. I would rather leave my items in my cart for possible purchase later. Also, I would rather see all of my carts, where they limit you to only 75 at a time.

title: The service  i receive from you.
text: Date of experience: September 05, 2023

title: Selection of goods
text: Selection of goods.  Website a bit confusing.

title: I have purchased some lovely things
text: I have purchased some lovely things.  But, they are not always as described. Inaccurate dating as antique or vintage is common. I realize there are not guarantees on Etsy, Ebay etc. either so I don't blame the site- but use the judgement you always should when purchasing online. I do love the 50% off Red tag Sale, which is when I buy most of my items

title: This is a general review of Ruby Lane
text: This is a general review of Ruby Lane,  not of any specific vendor.  While I like Ruby Lane very much, most of the vendors tend to over price their merchandise.   I appreciate those who are open to offers and find that most of my purchases are made that way.  I also look forward to the occasional site-wide sales and have purchased several saved items that way as well.  The site is easy to use and many of the vendors are a pleasure to work with and offer quality items.  So, yes, I'm a fan.

title: Purchase was easy but confused about payment method
text: Purchase was easy but confused about payment.  I paid with a credit card but I received an email from PayPal asking to sign up for PayPal.  I have a paypal account but chose to pay with a different credit card.  I suggest that you have an option to check either PayPal or Credit Card.

title: Received a timely response
text: received a timely response

title: I look at the links I get from Ruby…
text: I look at the links I get from Ruby Lane everyday. I get frustrated that the link gets me to the dealer, but then I have to fish to find the item. But I can do that.Usually I buy when things are on sale.The items are described well and items show up when I expect them. I need to spend more time setting up alerts for what I am hunting.

title: Ruby Lane
text: I love Ruby Lane and use it frequently. I have had many good experiences. I had a single difficult interaction with a seller and it took a bit too long for Ruby Lane to help us resolve it.One thing that is good about this site, and different from others I have tried, is that almost all shops show multiple views of the object. I find that very helpful.

title: Please overhaul your confusing, doesn't-make-any-sense customer interface
text: I love every product and every vendor I have experienced on Ruby Lane over the past couple of decades. I HATE the stupid, illogical customer interface with categories that don't make any sense. I hope the vendor interface is better. I always leave this comment on Trust Pilot and no one ever does anything to update this.

title: Loved the earrings at fist sight
text: Loved the earrings at fist sight.  The only, very slight glitch, was I had to create a new account, since it’s been years since my last purchase. Shipping and taxes added $10 to the price of the earrings but I believe they will be worth it.

title: I’d have given five stars
text: I’d have given five stars, except…I made an offer on an item and Ruby Lane automatically determined the amount was to low. And sent back a counter. The seller was willing to accept my offer. title: I really like the range of jewelry on…
text: I really like the range of jewelry on Ruby Lane. You can find some really interesting pieces at reasonable prices. They also provide shipping costs. It is difficult sometimes to work out who sends to Australia and who doesn't, although this time I emailed the shop owner and got a very prompt reply. I also know that some of the shops state that they will ship overseas, but this might make me tend to search more in these shops. I guess it will be easier as I become more familiar with a different way of doing things.

The price was shown and I thought he would accept my willingness to accept the price.  I did not know the procedure that had to be completed, so I just asked him to allow me to buy the toy. He answered by writing that he does not give things away. He could have just advised me to complete the procedure in a kinder fashion.  I purchased the toy anyway, forgiving him for his impatience.

title: The site is beautifully presented
text: The site is beautifully presented, has quality items for sale and does not seem to sell cheap counterfeit/fake ‘antique’ rubbish from India/China like Etsy or eBay. EBay and Etsy are full of such tat and it is annoying to wade through thousands of listings of fake antiques looking for the real deal. As such I rarely buy vintage or antique items off these websites. However, the 2 step purchasing process on Ruby Lane of having to put in an order and then waiting for an invoice is cumbersome. I have also had a few sellers drastically bump up postage costs from what was noted in the listing. The 2 step purchase process gives them the opportunity to do this and as a buyer, there’s not a lot you can do other than cough up the extra postage. This experience is rare however as the vast majority of sellers I’ve dealt with are honest and professional to deal with.It is also sometimes difficult to find the invoice in your purchase history - instead you have to go back to the original email sent by sellers. Seller feedback is also difficult to access. I’m not talking about the number of stars, I’m talking about actual written feedback of a purchaser’s buying experience with a seller. Given that items purchased are often significantly more expensive than those purchased from eBay or Etsy it would be good to be able to easily find seller reviews.Sale prices should also be able to be viewed in currencies other than USD or GBP - I have to separately google prices via an online currency converter. Main currency conversion should be available.

title: Awhile back I recommended Rubylane…
text: Awhile back I recommended Rubylane begin utilizing a similar payment method to the one employed on ebay.  On my previous Rubylane purchases the seller had to first send an invoice and it took 2 or 3 additional steps for the buyer to complete the purchase transaction (which was confusing at times).  I normally use paypal and ebay purchases seemed much simpler and straightforward.  I'm glad to see that Rubylane has now instituted a much simpler/easier method of payment.  Ebay may still currently have a slight edge on ease of tracking shipments and leaving feedback - since I hadn't purchased anything from Rubylane for awhile this may also have changed and become easier.  Anyway, I'm glad that Rubylane is taking the initiative to make the experience of buying easier/quicker.  Thanks and best regards.Mike

title: Three site Criticisms/Suggestions
text: I have Three site criticisms/suggestions. 1.) I would like it if Customer Feedback and Feedback ratings existed on Ruby Lane similarly to how they do on eBay. If they do, I didn't see any sign of it. I feel the possibility of positive or negative feedback is a good incentive for a seller to pack things well, provide tracking and ship in a timely manner after purchase as well as feedback about buyers, as incentive for buyers to be easy to work with and pleasant. 2.) I would have felt more comfortable if the page that had me select payment method had said "Payment will be completed on next page". I was nervous that by selecting PayPal, it would automatically charge my default PayPal payment method, which was not the card on PayPal that I wanted to use. Thankfully it did not do that and worked fine, but adding that line would be good.3.) I would like it if Ruby Lane had "Wish Lists" that would send buyers notifications if new listings matching Wish-list item keywords were posted.Still, I enjoy the site layout, ease of use, wide variety of payment options and am happy to be a new member. As long as Ruby Lane has good telephone customer service and good seller and buyer support, I could foresee my Family and I doing a lot of business, as buyers and sellers on Ruby Lane, down the line.~David

title: I LOVE everything about this vendor
text: I LOVE everything about this vendor. Gorgeous items! Responsive service!My only complaint is with Ruby Lane's checkout process which somehow involves PayPal. It is very confusing, unlike any other site I have purchased from. The Ruby Lane payment process makes a buyer seem like they are, and must, submit payment through PayPal. I prefer to use my credit card, Visa, for purchases, like many who like to use their own credit cards. Yet the option to pay with a credit card does not come up until after it appears the buyer has already purchased the item(s) through PayPal. Very confusing. Why does a purchaser have to go through this? Why is Ruby Lane's payment process like this? This is not fair to the quality vendors on the site who deserve a better payment process from Ruby Lane.

title: All went well until after I had…
text: All went well until after I had provided my Canadian Shipping and Billing address, and Ruby Lane had provided the amount of the sale in Canadian currency, and then I was asked for my (US) zip code! What?!?! Not an easy site to work with when it comes to signing up (my original email address was not recognized, had to sign up with a second one) or checkout. Some further attention to the automatic steps/links would help a lot! But I do love the goods, and the descriptions are excellent 😊.

title: Great site generally but room for improvement.
text: Great site where lots of beautiful goodies are to be found for serious collectors. Whilst there are undoubtably some lovely items for sale here, sellers do seem to have a tendency to overprice and will often drastically reduce prices when an expression of interest made, a good thing in one way, but what does it say about the original prices stated? The site is generally easy to navigate, but could be easier, for example, I’d like to be able to easily search for items by sellers in my own country but can’t see any easy way to do that. In my experience, the sellers have been friendly, trustworthy and conscientious when packing and posting items. The site is always a visual treat.

title: Easy and convenient

title: Constantly having to sign in

text: The one problem I have with Ruby Lane is the sign in.  I get an email saying something on my wish list is on the site.  I see it, try to favorite it and it makes me log in to Ruby Lane.  It logs me out if I use the back button to go back to the item I originally went to look at.   Then I have to re-search it to find it.   Inconvenient.  Otherwise, a bit pricey, but I LOVE IT..

title: I love the items that are sold on the…
text: I love the items that are sold on the Ruby Lane website.  I have been shopping on the site for many years.  However, this year I ran into two separate situations involved the attempted purchase of diamond earrings.  The first situation occurred when I wanted to place the earrings on layaway.  First, they told that it was okay and sent me pictures for my inspection.  One day later when I got ready to make a payment they old me that the earrings had been sold.  The second situation was similar, once again attempting to purchase diamond earrings but this time I was told that they pulled the item back and they said they were no longer available for purchase.  I was really saddened and was looking forward to purchasing those items.

Thanks Ruby Lane.

On one occasion I sent a second email to the seller asking if ignoring customers email was normal and he answered “those emails are generated by Rubylane and we don’t always get them.”Regardless he never asked me about my offer. title: I have ordered many items from venders…
text: I have ordered many items from venders on RubyLane over the last few years and have rarely been disappointed. I have ordered fewer items after RubyLane began to add taxes & (it seems) higher mail rates. I realize this is mostly a factor/decision of the individual vendors. I know of few sites (like none) that offer the variety of items that one can find on RubyLane. My problem is not being rich & now running out of room in my house for more items I want to buy (and can afford) to buy. Apparently, that doesn't stop me!

title: I was happy and excited to buy a…
text: I was happy and excited to buy a lovely, vintage doll from a wonderful seller. The page display of her and her details helped me make the decision to buy. Navigating the Ruby Lane web page to make the purchase was pretty basic. I wanted to send her as a gift to a friend but I did run into an obstacle (that the seller helped me to resolve). I would like to share with you, Ruby Lane, an idea that would be a way to navigate that obstacle as well as a nice benefit for buyers using Ruby Lane.Your program did not allow me to separate the billing address from the shipping address, making it difficult to ship what I bought as a gift to the recipient. I also thought of another scenario. If the purchased item needed some adjustments or repairs (at a "Dolly Spa" maybe?) that the buyer wanted to arrange, shouldn't the buyer have the opportunity to have the item shipped to the person/company that the buyer was going to have do those repairs? To have the ability to separate the two addresses would benefit buyers in both these cases (and save a little money). Thank you for listening.JB

title: Straightforward, good communication and I would use again

title: i really love this site and have bought…
text: i really love this site and have bought many items over the last several years.  There are some exceptionally professional and kind vendors who sell on this site.The checkout procedure appears to have improved significantly.  I especially  look forward to the Red Tag sales several times each year.  My only complaint is that lately many of the vendors on Ruby Lane double the regular price of the item and then offer 50 percent off the doubled price during  the "sale".  I really have an issue with this and wish they would consider offering a TRUE discount on just a few items.  When i see this practice, it causes me not to buy from those vendors.  I am including this in my review in the hope that it will be read by the vendors who engage in this practice. With this being said, I have gotten some real bargains on Ruby Lane and will continue to patronize those vendors who do not engage in "mark it up and mark it down" for the Red Tag sales.  If not for this practice, this would be a 5 +++ experience.

title: Love the Site - Purchasing Process Convoluted.
text: Thanks for the opportunity to review your system for purchasing items on Ruby Lane.  This was my first purchase.Your software program is relatively easy to navigate. But why is your "offer" process so convoluted?  Why have this intermediary step of getting a counter offer from your algorithm, then having a second offer option before sending it to the vendor?  Why not send the initial offer to the vendor directly and the vendor can make a decision? With two items in my cart to purchase, I made an offer on a 3rd item.  I accepted the counteroffer.  Then when that process was complete I had to pay for the negotiated item separately from the payment for the 2 items in the cart.  Each were paid separately.  Again, just seems convoluted.Lastly, via email I received a Purchase order # that is not the purchase itself.  One for the negotiated item and one for the two that had been in my cart.  There's a message alerting me that this is an invoice not a payment.  But I have NOT as of now received an email stating my PAID PURCHASES.  That's more important to me.  Maybe coming later?BUT ... other than that ... easy to navigate.  Like the variety of your vendors. Easy to follow the pathway for paying even tho' I think it's convoluted.

I’m having to pay the full  quoted price and that really hurts when I have to pay California sales tax on top of it.  I live on a small fixed income and every penny counts! title: Hard to find antiquities at fair prices
text: I have been what I consider a very loyal client of Ruby Lane’s for several years.  I am a frequent shopper of unique vintage home furnishings as well as Victorian era jewelry.  Ruby Lane has an amazing following of sellers that offer some of the finest art objects I have ever seen for sale.  As far as the merchandise and ease of check out and payment process, Ruby Lane is Tops.  There is only one issue they MUST fix to get my five star rating.  They MUST stand behind their promise that if a fake piece of merchandise is being sold, it will be clearly stated and if not, a refund is in order.  I had this situation happen and Ruby Lane did not stand behind their word.  I was stuck with a fake.  Other than that, if you KNOW what you are buying, it is a great site to buy from.

title: Ruby Lane Customer Service
text: I found Ruby Lane Customer Service very good to deal with after I had to ask them to help resolve a dispute I was having with one of their sellers. They were professional and prompt in their communication and they pursued the seller for the information I requested. My only complaint is that they don't seem to be in a position to insist that the seller do the right thing. Although I would never again purchase from the shop that I had trouble with, I don’t expect to have an experience like that again, & would be happy to purchase from other Ruby Lane dealers.

title: I was explicitly solicited by Ruby Lane…

The checkout process was as easy as any other place, no specific difficulties or frustrations.Since all I have done is place an order, there's no way I can post an effective review until the item arrives, so I think this instant review request is kind of self-defeating.If I were asked for a suggestion - which I haven't been - I would suggest to wait until after delivery to solicit a review.  That's when I am much more likely to be pleased compared to having only completed a routine online order.

title: Billing Questions
text: I enjoyed going through your site, and purchasing was relatively simple until it came time to check payment. I wanted to pay by credit card but it would only allow PayPal. I switched from PayPal to check so I'm waiting to see if it goes through or not. I put the PO # on the check so I'm crossing my fingers

title: I love the merchandise
text: I love the merchandise, and the new policy of withholding taxes does not bother me.  I have always kept track of taxes due on merchandise that I've purchased on-line and paid whenever I file my state income taxes.  However, I'm only rating four stars, because of the new buyer fees.  Ruby Lane's fees are minimal,  but I believe in the principle of "Beware the Entering Wedge".

title: Easy to use
text: Easy to use. Found exactly what I was looking for..

title: product was as advertised..
text: product was as advertised... delivery was prompt

title: Well presented platform
text: Well presented platform, good images and excellent sellers

title: I love Rubylane
text: I love Rubylane. With one exception, all sellers have been fabulous!I left one star off, due to the new “service charge” that Rubylane has started. The costs keep creeping up. Also, you can’t see the other charges now, unless you are checking out. I’d like to know before.

title: Good web site to search. Order process was a bit difficul
text: The description of the merchandise was very good, and the speed of page loading was also good. However, the check out process was difficult. I wanted to pay by credit card, but was inadvertently sent to PayPal. I don't know if my charge went through or not. I did get two e-mails confirming my order, so I assume everything is OK, but I'm not sure.

title: Reputable Sellers
text: Reputable Sellers, I always get great service from sellers on Ruby Lane.

title: Page viewing would be better if you…
text: Page viewing would be better if you were directed back to the previous spot in your shopping after viewing an item.Adding items to a favorites list does not always work as expected.

title: Mostly good experience
text: I haven't received my order yet, but based on the website and process, I was happy. I read about how Ruby Lane selects vendors, handles complaints, and so on, and felt confident about ordering. It was easy to navigate and understand. The only part of the process that I wasn't expecting was the additional fee to Ruby Lane. On many other selling sites, the seller pays the fees. I don't know if the Ruby Lane seller pays fees as well, but the buyer does. So the final price was more than I anticipated. Nevertheless, I will shop Ruby Lane again. I just will know in advance about the extras and not be surprised.

title: great info
text: I’ve bought several beautiful things at a great price.  I like that they include as much information on the piece I’m purchasing.  Who - What - Where -When!

title: I like the Ruby Lane experience
text: I like the Ruby Lane experience, but for the first time I noticed a “service charge” to RL.  It actually caused me to rethink for a few hours if I wanted to pay this extra.

title: Your products are fine; your process is sometimes lacking
text: I have no problem with your products; however, your website wasn't working correctly last night when I tried to make a purchase. When I clicked on "purchase" (or "submit" - whatever it was), nothing happened. I clicked on it 2-3 times, with the same result. So I gave up, fearing that I might be purchasing the item multiple times. This morning, I received an email that there was an unpurchased item in my cart, and I was able to finally purchase the item.

title: I have found most shop owners to be…
text: I have found most shop owners to be very pleasant and eager to collaborate and accommodate The most frustrating aspect of going through Ruby Lane is problems shop owners attribute to Pay Pal. For example, recently I offered to pay a discounted amount on an order of several items. The shop owner agreed but Pay Pal could not generate one running bill with modifications. The request was to pay item by item. Or just send 1 direct payment to store but without a bill. She insisted a Pay Pal issue because of changes in prices. Eventually I cancelled my order. Pay Pal problem another time.

title: I removed a star because I don’t like…
text: I removed a star because I don’t like the new combination of antiques with collectibles. Preferred them separate . Also when I look at top 50 in the relax column it used to go directly to most recent for that dealer and now you have to select a category to look at first and I don’t like that.Also I would like to be able to set it up so that most recent rather than best match shows up on each category page.Other than these items, I am very happy with the way Ruby Lane operates and the high caliber of its dealers.

title: Great choice of Victorian jewelry
text: Great choice of Victorian jewelry. Easy payments

title: I just made an offer on an item from…
text: I just made an offer on an item from one of your shops and it was accepted straightaway! Everything was pretty smooth and fast. The only thing I think you could improve on is your checkout process. It is still a bit confusing on how to find your invoice and pay. In other words, there needs to be a more obvious link.

title: Takes a minute to sign in
text: Takes a minute to sign in, than its a go.

title: In total context my experience with…
text: In total context my experience with Ruby Lane has been excellent!Recommendations:Transfer buyer fee to sellers! In current format , it acts as additional tax and works against sales.Set up system to allow tax exempt buyers since now charging sales tax!  Ebay has accomplished this allowance!Thanks, Jim Blott (Old Yellow Depot)

title: First transaction through Ruby Lane
text: First transaction through Ruby Lane, and ease of use is simply a breeze.

title: This  is my first purchase from Ruby…
text: This  is my first purchase from Ruby Lane and I found the process of signing up and ordering very simple.  Hopefully the piece I bought is as advertised.

title: Quite good communication and…
text: Quite good communication and interaction, but time elapsed before sending not as quick as one might have expected.

title: Love the merchandise and the updates on…
text: Love the merchandise and the updates on your wish list......for some reason I needed to type my address in three times .... even after saving it....plus the orders are done separately so if you order more than one thing from a different vendor you have to put all your payment information in again......a little tedious.....

title: Great service
text: Great service! I would suggest there would be an app available to easily assess my account with them.

title: I would prefer the option of paying via…
text: I would prefer the option of paying via credit or debit card.  I don't trust PayPal!

title: Service fee
text: Service fee? Really?

title: Overall an excellent site.
text: Overall an excellent site.Wish that notifications for new items from favorite sellers were sent to me in a more timely manner.Yes, I know you are on the West Coast but most of the country isn't.

title: Great choice but ....
text: Ruby Lane has a great variety of sellers and items for purchase, so it offers a good choice for the savvy purchaser. However they have recently introduced additional fees, so it is not as good value as it was before. Am reeling from sticker shock ….
